sourceMeaningMnemonic: You use a <radical>thread</radical> for <radical>good luck</radical> by <kanji>bind</kanji>ing two fingers together. You <kanji>tie</kanji> them nice and tight.
meaningInfo: Tying two fingers together with a good luck thread is very common where you're from.
readingMnemonic: After you <kanji>bind</kanji> your fingers, the good luck starts pouring in. Literally. Suddenly <reading>ketsu</reading>p (<ja>けつ</ja>) starts pouring down from the heavens.
readingInfo: This ketsup is exactly what you were looking for, but now it won't stop. You need to get out of this bind by untying the thread on your finger. But it won't budge. It's covered in ketsup. Help! You're going to drown!
